From the home screen, swipe down to display the favorites panel and swipe up to hide it. 
 
If you swipe up when the favorites panel is hidden, it will display the complete list of applications. Swipe down from the top of this list to come back to the home screen. 
 
Press the button below the favorites panel to display the menu of the launcher. 
 
If you hold your finger a few moments on an application or a folder, you will be offered to access its settings.

"The notification allows to display a popup with favorites above other applications when you leave the home screen. 
In most cases, it should work directly and without issues. 
However, in some special cases it may bring back to the home screen instead of being displayed over other applications. 
If you are facing this issue, there are two things you can try: 
- Press the "clear all" button in Recent Apps. 
- Reboot your smartphone. 
After one of these actions, the problem should not appear again. 
If it persists, I am sorry but it seems this will not work for you :
- Finally, if you change the default launcher, you may still see the notification.
To hide it, you can open Stability and Faster Launcher (no need to be the default launcher) and disable the notification in the settings."

\(Android 7.0\+, no external display required\)
 Launcher lets you launch apps in freeform floating windows on Android 7.0+ devices. No root access is required, although Android 8.0, 8.1, and 9 devices require an adb shell command to be run during initial setup.
 Simply follow these steps to configure your device for launching apps in freeform mode:

 1. Check the box for "Freeform window support" inside the Taskbar app
 2. Follow the directions that appear in the pop-up to enable the proper settings on your device (one-time setup)
 3. Go to your device's recent apps page and clear all recent apps
 4. Start launch, then select an app to launch it in a freeform window.

The list of applications and their icons are refreshed only after some events (on start, when an application is added or removed, if the icon pack is modified). When this happens, a small popup message appears during a few moments. \n \nIf something does not feel right, you should try to refresh the applications list manually.

You can create as many folders as you want to organize your applications. These folders can also be added in favorites. If a folder is removed, its content will be put back in the main applications list. \n \nAn application can be in only one folder at a time (or not in a folder). However, you can have both an application and the folder containing this application in favorites.
